conditions.short_description: Southeast severe blizzard in mountains on Monday night. Human triggered avalanches in SW part. Unstable wind slabs in W-facing slopes. Weak layers in the SW-corner and southern Westfjords.
conditions.full_description: Southeast severe blizzard in mountains on Monday evening and considerable new snow being added in northwest and west aspects. Two human triggered avalanches reported on the 19th of Feb. in the SW part of the country in small steep slopes. Considerable snow was before in the country, it has drifted in strong winds. Easterly winds have been prevailing so older unstable wind slabs are most likely in W-facing slopes. Weak layers have been found in the snow in the SW-corner and southern Westfjords. Cornices are widely and they may collapse.

area_forecast.forecast: Severe blizzard in mountains on Monday evening will form windslabs in northwesterly aspects, and earlier much snow is had drifted in E-winds. Weak layers increase the likelihood of human triggered avalanches. Snowstorm on Tuesday will probably maintain instabilities.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: A child was buried 19.2. when snow collapsed on it from Hamarinn above Hveragerði. Another human triggered avalanche 19.2. in a small steep slope south of Þingvallavatn. A naturally triggered avalanche released in Reykjafell in Mosfellsbær on 20.02.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Considerable new snow in very strong southeast winds on Monday evening, and earlier much snow had accumulated in west facing slopes due to prevailing easterly winds. Weak layers have been found in the area, differently deeply buried. This increases the likelihood of human triggered avalanches. Instabilities are expected to be maintained in strong southwest winds with snow on Tuesday.
area_forecast.weather: Suðaustanátt á mánudagskvöld, 23-28 m/s, mikil snjókoma til fjalla og hlýnandi veður. Suðvestan stormur eða rok fram eftir degi á þriðjudag, gengur á með éljum og kólnar aftur. Heldur hægari breytileg átt um kvöldið, og dálítil snjókoma. Hæg norðlæg eða breytileg átt á miðvikudag og fimmtudag, þurrt og kalt í veðri.

area_forecast.forecast: Unstable windslabs in westerly aspects and increasing after ENE storm night to Tuesday. Windslabs expected in easterly aspects after strong SW on Tuesday. NE storm and snowfall on Wednesday that can create high avalanche danger in mountains.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: Cornices collapsed in Skutulsfjörður 19.2. and triggered avalanches.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Much snow has been added in easterly winds. Most snow is therefore expected to have accumulated in W-facing slopes. Cornices have collapsed and triggered avalanches. Snow is thought mostly wind packed and stiff. Increased instability expected after ENE storm night to Tuesday and higher instability in NE storm on Wednesday.
area_forecast.weather: A-NA 20-25 m/s og hríðarveður aðfaranótt þriðjudags. Breytilegur vindur á þriðjudag, hvöss SV-átt með snjókomu um tíma seinnipartinn. NA stormur með snjókomu á miðvikudag. Dregur úr vind og snjókomu á fimmtudagsmorgun, hægar áttir yfir daginn og herðir á frosti.

area_forecast.forecast: There have been very strong E-winds last two days with wild snowdrift on ridges. Tonight the SE-winds will be picking up, turning to E with snowfall for a while and SW-winds tomorrow.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: Minor avalanches fell in Ólafsfjörður during the weekend in wild E-wind. Avalanche fell the night to Friday in Kerahnjúkur"s S-face. Two slabs were remotely triggered 12.2. (300-500 m) by a snowmobile in Burstabrekkudalur, SW-W aspect, 30-60 cm fracture line sliding on blue ice.
area_forecast.snow_condition: New windslabs have formed in westerly aspects showing activity. Older windslabs are possible in most aspects due to variable wind directions lately and they can be unstable with icy firn surface below the slabs. Snowpit from Illviðrishjnúkur 19.2. showed a firm windslab on top of weaker layers. Stability tests gave medium results. Snowpit from Burstabrekkudalur 19.2. showed new snow on top of windslabs and stable firn underneath. Stability test gave medium results in the windslabs at 63 cm.
area_forecast.weather: Mjög hvöss SA-læg átt í nótt með snjókomu um tíma en snýst í ekki síður hvassa SV-átt á morgun þri með snjókomu um tíma í vesturfjöllum.

area_forecast.forecast: Unstable wind slabs possible in various aspects, especially though west facing. SE-E storm with heavy snowfall night to Tuesday and increased avalanche danger expected because of that.
area_forecast.snow_condition: New wind slabs, that can be unstable, have formed in west facing slopes. Older windslabs exist in most aspects after variable winds but are considered rather local. A snow pit from Oddskarð 19.2. showed loose snow on top of wind packed snow and hard crust underneath. A stiff layer was 27-30 cm deep, and a compression test showed a fracture after heavy force where this layer meets the loose snow on top. The temperature gradient was also high over this intersection which can lead to crystallization and the formation of weak layers. SE and E storm with heavy snowfall the night to Tuesday is expected to lead to the formation of new unstable wind slabs in W and NW aspects. On Thursday snow is expected to accumulate in S facing slopes.
area_forecast.weather: Áköf snjókoma og skafrenningur í SA- og A-stormi eða -roki aðfaranótt þriðjudags. Snýst í sunnanátt á þriðjudagsmorgun og styttir upp. Fremur hæg breytileg átt á þriðjudag og miðvikudag, lítilsháttar ofankoma í hægum vindi aðfaranótt miðvikudags. Hvassar norðlægar áttir á fimmtudag með snjókomu.

weather_forecast.forecast: Southeast severe blizzard in mountains on Monday evening. Strong southwest winds and considerable showers of snow in the south- and west parts on Tuesday. Northerly winds and blizzard conditions in the north on Wednesday, but dry in the south. Winds moderating on Thursday. ri og miklum vindi.
